abstract.text: A view controller that can upgrade user passwords to strong passwords, or convert accounts to use Sign in with Apple.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Adding an account modification extension lets your app seamlessly upgrade user passwords to strong passwords, or convert from using passwords to using Sign in with Apple. The entire process can be automatic, requiring no user interaction, or you can include interactions, such as two-factor authentication confirmation.
This class ignores calls from Mac apps built with Mac Catalyst.

abstract.text: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.
An object that performs a request to modify an account’s authentication properties.
An interface you implement for receiving success and failure statuses about modification of an account’s authentication properties.
An interface you implement to coordinate presentation of the user interface when modifying an account’s authentication properties.
An object that you interact with to change an account’s password or to upgrade to Sign in with Apple.
A view controller that can upgrade user passwords to strong passwords, or convert accounts to use Sign in with Apple.
Cancels a request that the user initiated.
Upgrades a user’s weak password to a strong password.
Converts an account’s authentication mechanism from using passwords to using Sign in with Apple.
The context your account authentication modification extension uses to provide information to the system.
Prepares the view controller’s interface that displays when upgrading from a weak password to a strong password.
Prepares the view controller’s interface that displays when converting an account that uses password authentication to use Sign in with Apple.
Automatically and transparently convert accounts to Sign in with Apple or to use strong passwords for improved security.

doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/d.title: Upgrading Account Security With an Account Authentication Modification Extension

abstract.text: A Boolean value that indicates the system shouldn’t show security recommendation prompts when users sign in using the app.
The rules the system satisfies when generating a strong password for your extension during an automatic upgrade.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the extension supports upgrading a user’s password to a strong password.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the extension supports upgrading from using password authentication to using Sign in with Apple.
A controller that manages a view, typically loaded from a nib file.
An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the [`UIAppearance`](doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance) API.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
Methods for adding objects to your state restoration archives.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

topicSections.title: Upgrading to Sign in with Apple

value.title: Upgrading to Sign in with Apple
